Class ViewManager

java.lang.Object
com.gr15.pacman.view.ViewManager
public class ViewManager extends Object
Manages multiple views in a JavaFX application by allowing switching between them using unique keys. Each view is expected to extend BaseView.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    ViewManager.ViewKeys
    Enumeration of all possible view keys used to identify different views.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ViewManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of ViewManager. If it does not exist yet, it is created.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of ViewManager.

    • addView

      public void addView(ViewManager.ViewKeys key, BaseView view)
      Adds a new view to the manager.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to identify the view.
      view - the view to be added.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a view with the same key already exists or - key is null - view is null

    • showView

      public void showView(ViewManager.ViewKeys key)
      Displays the view associated with the specified key. Calls onExit on the current view (if any) and onEnter on the new view.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the view to be shown.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no view exists for the specified key, or key is null

    • hasView

      public boolean hasView(ViewManager.ViewKeys key)
      Checks whether a view exists for the specified key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to check.
      Returns:
      true if a view with the key exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if key is null

    • removeView

      public void removeView(ViewManager.ViewKeys key)
      Removes the view associated with the specified key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the view to remove.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if key is null

    • getRoot

      public javafx.scene.Parent getRoot()
      Returns the root node that contains the currently active view. This root can be added to the JavaFX scene graph.
      Returns:
      the root Parent node.
